item.description:
Good news! Jonathan Twining, Assistant Professor of Biology at Eastern Nazarene College has offered to help us start the Friends of MSSF Vernal Pool Program (VPP). John Young and Evelyn Strawn have stepped up to co-chair the Vernal Pool Committee, so we are ready to start!

We will begin the VPP with an indoor training session (this meeting) conducted by Professor Twining, who has promised to follow up with field training sessions in April and possibly May. We are looking for 12 volunteers to help find, certify, and monitor vernal pools in MSSF.

Please visit the Eastern Nazarene College Vernal Pool Information Center for more information about vernal pools and why they are important. If you are interested in volunteering for the FMSSF VPP, please try to come to this meeting. If you cannot make it to the meeting, that's OK. You can catch up at the field training sessions. Hope to see you there!
item.why: Vernal pools are essential to wildlife and water quality. Preliminary studies indicate that MSSF contains 70 to 90 vernal pools, nine of them have been certified. Identifying vernal pools where rare plants and animals live will help protect them.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Vernal Pools Project Training
